preprocess_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices

Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks

 Appendices

Key Points:
- Project: Digital Loan Application and Approval System by XYZ Bank
- Objective: Create an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, complete KYC requirements, track application status, and receive approval digitally.
- Features: Include online application form, integration with CIBIL for credit score, AI-based eligibility and risk assessment, real-time KYC document verification, loan sanction via OTP, and integration with core banking for disbursement.
- Stakeholders: Product Manager Rahul Sharma, Business Head - Retail Lending Priya Iyer, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha, Compliance Lead Anjali Mehta.
- Timeline: From requirements finalization on 15 March 2025 to go-live on 1 July 2025.

Actions:
- Finalize requirements by 15 March 2025
- Kick off development by 1 April 2025
- Complete UAT by 1 June 2025
- Move system to go-live on 1 July 2025

Blockers: 
- Potential delay in API access to credit bureau
- Resistance from customers reluctant to use the digital onboarding process
- Possible changes to compliance requirements due to upcoming RBI guidelines.  

Success Metrics: 
- Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours
- 80% reduction in manual data entry
- 90% accuracy in eligibility checks

2. The new platform will allow customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility assessments, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval digitally.
3. The platform will include features like an online loan application form, integration with credit bureaus, an AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module, real-time KYC document verification, loan sanction and e-agreement signing, and integration with core banking.
4. The stakeholders mainly include the Product Manager, Business Head of Retail Lending, IT Manager, and Compliance Lead.
5. The system assumptions include a requirement for the customer to have an Aadhaar-linked mobile number and will support both English and Hindi.

Actions:
1. The timeline provided requires requirements finalization by 15 March 2025, development kickoff by 1 April 2025, UAT by 1 June 2025, and the system to go live by 1 July 2025.

Blockers:
1. Delay in API access to credit bureau, potential resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding, and compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines pose challenges to the project.

Success Metrics:
1. The project aims to reduce the turnaround time from 5 days to 2 hours, reduce manual data entry by 80%, and achieve 90% accuracy in eligibility checks.

summarize_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices
summarize_audit.output:
Key Points:
1. The project aims to digitize XYZ Bank's personal loan application and approval process to reduce errors, improve customer experience, and shorten the turnaround time (TAT).
2. The digital platform will provide services like online application, eligibility assessment, document upload, application status tracking, and digital loan approval. 
3. The scope excludes modules related to home loans, car loans, and business loans as well as agent-assisted journey for Tier 3 regions. 
4. The project stakeholders include Rahul Sharma (Product Manager), Priya Iyer (Business Head – Retail Lending), Rakesh Sinha (IT Manager), and Anjali Mehta (Compliance Lead).
5. Key features include AI-based risk assessment, Aadhaar/PAN card verification, real-time KYC verification, and a customer dashboard for loan status tracking.

Actions:
1. Commence project with requirement finalization by 15th March, 2025 and kick-off development from 1st April, 2025.
2. Execute UAT testing by 1st June, 2025 and aim for a Go-Live date of 1st July, 2025.

Blockers:
1. Delay in API access to Credit Bureau may impact the project timeline.
2. Customer resistance to digital onboarding can interfere with the adoption and success of the platform.
3. Upcoming RBI guidelines may dash with the current compliance plan and require adjustments. 

Success Metrics:
1. Reduction of TAT from 5 days to 2 hours.
2. 80% reduction in manual data entry.
3. 90% accuracy in eligibility checks.

- The system will support English and Hindi
- Loan disbursement will only occur through verified bank accounts.
